content: Steve Alexander highlights fantasy basketball names trending upwards or downwards, with key takeaways for each.

title: Tout Clings To Moving Truck As Extortion Bid Backfires In Madhya Pradesh
content: In a dramatic incident in Rewa district, an attempt by a tout to extort money from a truck driver backfired when the driver refused to comply and drove away, forcing the tout to cling to the moving vehicle for nearly five kilometres to save his life.

title: In A First, India's 'Baahubali' Rocket To Launch Big US Commercial Satellite
content: This Christmas Eve could mark a historic milestone in global connectivity as India's most powerful rocket, the Launch Vehicle Mark-3 (LVM3), popularly known as Baahubali, prepares for its eighth flight.

title: Migrant Worker Lynched In Kerala After Being Mistaken As "Bangladeshi"
content: What began as a search for employment ended in an unthinkable tragedy for a young migrant worker from Chhattisgarh. Thirty-one-year-old Ramnarayan Baghel, 31, a resident of Sakti district, travelled to Kerala in search of work.

title: "Casteist Remarks, Unfathomable Threats": Pilot Accused Of Assault Responds
content: The Air India Express pilot, who allegedly assaulted a passenger at Delhi airport after a dispute over jumping a queue, has spoken out. A law firm has put out a statement on behalf of Captain Virender Sejwal.

title: Explained: Why Aravalli Is In Spotlight And What Environmentalists Demand
content: Beyond the legal semantics, the concerns are deeply rooted in the Aravallis' indispensable ecological functions.

title: 'No More Jago Maa, Sing Secular Song': Bengal Singer Harassed, Man Arrested
content: Lagnajita Chakraborty said the accused, Mehboob Mallik, abused her and attempted to assault her during her live show at a private school in East Midnapore.

title: Train Tickets To Cost More. Check Fare Hikes For Different Coaches
content: Train journeys are set to become dearer as the Railways implements a fare hike starting December 26. While fares for suburban train travel have not been hiked, longer journeys would cost more.

title: 9 Killed As Gunmen Randomly Shoot At People On Streets In South Africa
content: Nine people were killed when gunmen opened fire at a bar outside Johannesburg early Sunday, police said, in the second such shooting in South Africa this month.

title: Video: Ramdev Challenges Journalist To Wrestle, What Happens Next
content: Yoga guru Ramdev challenged a journalist to a wrestling match, which ended in a surprising showdown. At an event, Ramdev approached the editor for a sparring session, only to discover that his opponent was an experienced wrestler.

title: Petition Drive Launched Against Supreme Court's Definition Of Aravallis
content: As signatures continue to pour in, activists emphasise the Aravallis' role in regulating climate, preventing man-animal conflict, and sustaining water security.

title: Videos: Kashmir Sees Season's First Snowfall As Harsh Winter Begins
content: The higher reaches of Kashmir received its first snowfall of the season, and rain lashed the plains of the Valley, heralding the first day of the 40 days of harsh winter cold, locally known as 'Chillai Kalan'.

title: BJP Inches Towards Thumping Win In Maharashtra Local Body Polls
content: The BJP-led Mahayuti alliance has taken a big lead in the elections to 246 municipal councils and 42 nagar panchayats in Maharashtra

title: "Understanding RSS Via BJP's Lens A Huge Mistake": Mohan Bhagwat
content: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday said that attempting to understand the organisation through comparisons or political lenses often leads to misunderstandings.

title: Massive Power Outage Leaves San Francisco In Dark, 130,000 Residents Affected
content: A huge electricity outage hit San Francisco on Saturday, leaving 130,000 residents without power for several hours at its peak, with the city's main provider saying all services would return overnight.

title: Madhya Pradesh Debt Hits Rs 4.65 Lakh Crore, Ministers Express Concern
content: Madhya Pradesh's total debt has risen to Rs 4.65 lakh crore, exceeding the state's total budget of Rs 4.21 lakh crore for the financial year 2025-26.

title: Saudi Arabia Expands Liquor Store's Access To Wealthy Non-Muslims
content: Saudi Arabia has quietly expanded access to its only store that sells alcohol, allowing wealthy foreign residents to buy booze in the latest step in the once-ultraconservative kingdom's experiment in liberalization.

title: "Equal Rights For Religions": Telangana To Bring Law To Curb Hate Speech
content: Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy on Saturday proposed a new law to punish those who insult any religion and revealed that the state government is planning to amend existing laws to ensure stricter punishment for anyone who abuses a religion.

title: 'No One Saw Or Heard': Bangladesh Hindu Killed, But No 'Blasphemy' Witness
content: There is no direct evidence that Dipu Chandra Das, the Hindu man lynched in Bangladesh's Mymensingh for alleged blasphemy, actually made any remark hurting anyone's religious sentiment, investigation into the chilling murder has found.

title: 12 Unknown Suspects Behind Johannesburg Mass Shooting: What We Know So Far
content: At least 12 unknown suspects were behind the mass shooting near Johannesburg in South Africa - in which nine people died, and nine others were injured.

title: Elon Musk's Net Worth Nears $750 Billion After Tesla Stock Options Restored
content: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk's net worth rose to nearly $750 billion after a US court reinstated Tesla stock options worth $139 billion.

title: B'desh unrest: India rebuts Dhaka media's 'propaganda'; flags atrocities against minorities
content: India has dismissed Bangladeshi media reports as "misleading propaganda" regarding a protest outside its High Commission in New Delhi. The demonstration, involving a small group, protested the killing of a minority member in Mymensingh. India is monitoring the situation in Bangladesh and has conveyed strong concerns over minority atrocities, urging justice for the victim.

title: Messi got Rs 89cr for India tour, govt Rs 11cr as tax: Organiser blames ‚Äòinfluential' people
content: Event organizer Satadru Dutta was arrested following chaos during the Messi tour in Kolkata. Police seized Rs 22 crore from his accounts, suspecting black money use. Dutta claimed Rs 100 crore was spent, but investigators doubt his financial figures. He also blamed others for the event's disorder, citing pressures for increased access.

title: 'Huge mistake': Bhagwat on viewing RSS through BJP lens; clarifies objective of outfit
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that understanding the Sangh through the BJP lens is a ‚Äúhuge mistake‚Äù and stressed that the organisation has no political agenda. Addressing programmes in Kolkata, he said the RSS should not be compared to political or service organisations and works for the betterment and protection of Hindu society, calling for opinions about the Sangh to be based on facts rather than narratives.

title: Microsoft AI CEO: Mission for self-sufficient AI models; vows safest superintelligence
content: Microsoft's AI chief, Mustafa Suleyman, aims for self-sufficiency in developing world-class, safe superintelligence. He acknowledges the immense costs, potentially hundreds of billions, making it challenging for startups to compete with tech giants like Microsoft, which possesses significant financial muscle and infrastructure. The race for advanced AI is driving massive investments across major tech firms.

title: Train travel gets costlier: Here is how much your ticket will cost now
content: Indian Railways will implement a revised fare structure from December 26 to address rising operational and manpower costs. Passengers traveling beyond 215 km in Ordinary Class will see a 1 paise per kilometer increase, while Mail and Express non-AC and AC coaches will face a 2 paise per kilometer hike. Suburban and monthly season tickets remain unchanged.

title: U19 Asia Cup: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi fails again; departs cheaply in final
content: Teenage prodigy Vaibhav Sooryavanshi was dismissed for 26 in the U19 Asia Cup final against Pakistan. Pakistan opener Sameer Minhas starred with a brilliant 172, propelling Pakistan to a massive 347/8. India, chasing the steep target, found themselves in deep trouble after early wickets. Sooryavanshi also failed to score big in the semi-final against Sri Lanka.

title: TCS AI revenue: CEO says AI is growing faster than core business; $1.5B run-rate revealed
content: Tata Consultancy Services is aggressively pursuing global leadership in AI-led technology services, targeting a $1.5 billion annualised revenue run-rate for its AI division. CEO K Krithivasan outlined a five-pronged strategy, emphasizing internal transformation, customer-focused AI solutions, talent development, and ecosystem building. Acquisitions, like the recent $700 million Coastal Cloud deal, are key to enhancing capabilities and market access.

title: Pay to meet Tihar inmates: Operators' role under lens over illegal mulakat charges
content: A racket charging relatives for legally free inmate meetings at Tihar Jail has been exposed. An inmate's tip-off led to an investigation where undercover officials were asked for money. As a precaution, 20-25 data entry operators were transferred while the probe into touts and system misuse continues. Biometric authentication is being introduced to enhance security.

title: B'desh unrest: India suspends visa services in Chittagong; cites security concerns, protests
content: Indian visa operations in Chittagong have been indefinitely suspended following protests near the Indian High Commission. This closure, along with earlier disruptions in Dhaka and other cities, comes amid rising tensions in Bangladesh. Ministry of external affairs has expressed strong concern and also refuted certain media reports regarding recent protests.

title: 'Really bad example': Bangladeshi scribe on violence after Hadi's death; flags lapses
content: A senior Bangladeshi journalist has criticized the post-death violence following the killing of activist Osman Hadi, citing serious law and order lapses. He stated that while public grief was understandable, fringe elements exploited the situation, leading to attacks on media and cultural institutions, sending a troubling signal ahead of the national election slated for February.

title: US department of state gives update on the delay in Visa appointments
content: American embassies worldwide, including in India, are facing up to a year-long wait for visa appointments due to enhanced screening. Tech giants like Google and Apple are now cautioning H-1B visa holders against international travel, fearing extended stays abroad. New social media checks are causing significant backlogs, impacting professionals and their families.

title: Chillai-Kalan begins: Kashmir sees snow and rain in its higher reaches - watch
content: Kashmir experienced fresh snowfall in higher reaches and rain in plains as Chillai-Kalan, the harshest winter period, commenced after a dry spell. Authorities have finalized preparations for potential heavy snowfall, anticipating improved air quality and a boost to winter tourism despite possible hardships.

title: T20 World Cup: 'Jaiswal deserved spot over Ishan'- Ex-India batter calls out India‚Äôs picks
content: Former opener Wasim Jaffer has voiced strong opinions on India's 2026 T20 World Cup squad, advocating for Yashasvi Jaiswal and Jitesh Sharma over Ishan Kishan and Washington Sundar. Jaffer's critique follows Shubman Gill's surprising omission. Axar Patel is now vice-captain. The tournament, co-hosted by Sri Lanka and India, sees the defending champions in Group A.

title: No ‚Äòsanskar‚Äô: UP police arrest four women after sons ‚Äòharass‚Äô teen girl
content: In Budaun, police arrested four mothers under preventive laws after their sons, all under 13, allegedly harassed a Class 8 girl. The action aims to hold parents accountable for not instilling 'good values'. Fathers, working out of state, will face arrest upon return. Legal experts question the use of preventive detention against parents.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office collection day 17: The Ranveer Singh, Akshaye Khanna starrer crosses Rs 530 crore, breaks 'Gadar 2' record, remains unaffected by 'Avatar Fire And Ash'
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' is shattering box office records, entering its third week with impressive earnings. The film defied competition from 'Avatar Fire And Ash', even showing growth on its third Saturday. With a total collection of ‚Çπ530.26 crore, it has now surpassed the lifetime collection of 'Gadar 2', marking a significant achievement in Indian cinema.

title: Investor onboarding loses pace: Fresh equity registrations fall 11% in November
content: New investor additions to India's stock markets slowed in November, with 13.2 lakh new traders joining, an 11.6% dip from October. Global uncertainty impacted participation, though the overall investor base reached 12.3 crore. This moderation follows a period of rapid growth, indicating a cautious sentiment among potential investors amidst volatile global conditions.

title: God of War 1 & 2 Remake update, what to expect, release date, gameplay features, and other details
content: Fans hoping for a God of War Greek Saga Remaster for the 20th anniversary were disappointed, but rumors persist of a potential rebuild for modern consoles.  A remake could bring a visual overhaul with Unreal Engine 5, modernized combat, and possibly narrative tweaks to bridge Kratos' past and present journeys.  Details remain unconfirmed.

title: French culture boss accused of mass 'drinks spiking' to humiliate women
content: A former culture ministry HR manager, Christian Negre, allegedly drugged around 200 women with diuretics during job interviews, forcing them into humiliating situations. Hiyam Zarouri recounts being made to walk for hours in pain after her coffee was spiked. Negre admitted to imposing humiliating situations and was fired, but victims fear he still poses a threat.

title: Can I lore drop? How Gen Z language is changing mental therapy, one word at a time
content: Young patients are increasingly using social media-derived psychological terms in therapy, presenting a new challenge for clinicians. While this vocabulary aids expression, it also leads to self-diagnosis and over-pathologizing normal experiences. Therapists are adapting to bridge this linguistic gap, validating feelings while reframing them accurately.

title: Video: Sitting outside home, 92-year-old killed as gravel dumper overturns on him in MP
content: A 92-year-old man was tragically crushed to death in Gwalior when a gravel-laden dumper overturned while passing his house. The vehicle's rear wheel sank into the road, causing it to topple and trap the victim. Police have seized the dumper and are searching for the driver and cleaner who fled the scene.

title: 2026 New Year getaways: Room tariffs rise 10‚Äì20% as hotels bet on premium packages
content: Hotels are significantly increasing New Year's Eve room rates by 10-20% for 2026, driven by robust demand in leisure and urban destinations.  Guests can expect elaborate packages, from yoga and cocktail workshops to recovery brunches, with average daily rates up 10-12% year-on-year.  Travel platforms report a substantial surge in bookings, indicating a strong festive season.

title: T20 World Cup: 'He respected the game'- Ashwin explains how Ishan earned his recall
content: Ishan Kishan has earned his way back into India's T20 World Cup squad after a dominant Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy campaign, leading Jharkhand to their first title.  He emerged as the tournament's top scorer with 517 runs.  Ravichandran Ashwin highlighted Kishan's renewed respect for domestic cricket as the key to his successful return, emphasizing dedication over external factors.

title: 'Enough, sing something secular': Noted singer Lagnajita Chakraborty abused, physically harassed
content: A cultural program in Bhagwanpur turned chaotic when singer Lagnajita Chakraborty faced harassment for a devotional song. The school owner interrupted her performance and allegedly used abusive language. Chakraborty and her band left the venue and filed a complaint. Police have arrested the owner and ordered an inquiry into local police actions. The incident has sparked political controversy.

title: South Africa shooting: Gunmen arrive in two vehicles and begin firing at a pub; nine killed
content: At least nine people were killed and 10 wounded in a mass shooting at a tavern in Bekkersdal, near Johannesburg, early Sunday. Gunmen arrived in two vehicles and fired indiscriminately at patrons inside and outside the bar. This is the second mass shooting in South Africa this month, highlighting the country's ongoing struggle with violent crime.

title: UP: Ex-CISF officer booked for killing man over affair with daughter; accused says he shot himself
content: A retired CISF sub-inspector and his wife are booked for allegedly murdering a 28-year-old man over suspicion of an affair with their daughter. The victim, who ran an IELTS center from their home, was found shot dead. The wife claims the victim shot her and then himself over a financial dispute.

title: Telangana horror: Man rapes girlfriend in Mahabubnagar; woman bleeds to death
content: A 20-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping his 22-year-old girlfriend, leading to her death in Mahabubnagar district. The incident occurred in a village's Rythu Vedika, and the victim, belonging to the SC community, fell unconscious and bled profusely. Police registered a case under the SC/ST Act, clarifying no link to nearby election celebrations.

title: Mukesh praises Ranveer: 'I denied him Shaktimaan, but...'
content: Veteran actor Mukesh Khanna has lauded Ranveer Singh's blockbuster 'Dhurandhar' as a 'perfect film,' praising its performances, direction, and crew. He particularly highlighted Akshaye Khanna's impactful role, drawing parallels to iconic villains. Khanna also addressed his earlier stance on Ranveer Singh's potential 'Shaktimaan' casting, acknowledging the actor's talent and energy.

title: J&K: Terrorists take food from village house to forest; search operation launched
content: Security forces are conducting a major search operation in Udhampur, Jammu and Kashmir, after two terrorists allegedly took food from a villager's home before disappearing into a nearby forest. This joint operation follows a recent encounter in the same region where a policeman lost his life. The combing effort aims to track down the militants.

title: Watch: Mumbai BJP MLA slaps auto-rickshaw driver; Congress hits out
content: A video shows BJP MLA Parag Shah slapping a rickshaw driver in Ghatkopar East. The MLA stated the driver was violating traffic rules and residents had complained about such incidents. The incident occurred during a protest against traffic violations. Police are investigating the matter. The opposition criticized the MLA's actions.

title: ‚ÄòStuck in India‚Äô: US cancels H-1b interviews, leaving workers stranded back home
content: Hundreds of Indian H-1B visa holders are stranded in India after US consulates abruptly canceled their work permit renewal appointments, rescheduling them months later. This disruption follows the Trump administration's expanded social media vetting policy, leaving highly skilled workers facing job uncertainty and significant delays in returning to the US.

title: Devon Conway etches his name in history, becomes the first to achieve this feat‚Ä¶
content: Devon Conway etched his name in New Zealand cricket history by becoming the first player to score a double-century and a century in the same Test match. His monumental 227 in the first innings and a subsequent 100 in the second guided New Zealand to a dominant position. This remarkable achievement places him among an elite global group of cricketers.

title: US visa delays: Indian H-1B workers stranded as Trump admin starts social media checks
content: US companies are grappling with significant disruptions as tighter social media checks by the Trump administration have led to prolonged visa stamping delays for Indian professionals. Many H-1B visa holders are stranded in India, forcing employers to explore remote work options or expedite travel back to the US to avoid visa expiry.

title: SC regularises BDS degrees of Rajasthan students; private dental colleges penalised
content: The Supreme Court has regularised Bachelor of Dental Surgery degrees for students admitted to Rajasthan private dental colleges with relaxed NEET criteria. The court held colleges and the state government accountable for violating admission rules. Affected students will provide pro-bono services. Private colleges must deposit Rs 10 crore each, and the Rajasthan government Rs 10 lakh.

title: Toasters, air fryers & hair dryers identified as major indoor pollution sources: Study
content: Household appliances like toasters and hair dryers are releasing trillions of ultrafine particles, posing health risks. These tiny particles, containing heavy metals, can penetrate deep into lungs and the bloodstream, potentially leading to inflammation and serious health issues. Simple engineering changes and user habits can significantly reduce this indoor air pollution.

title: Ex-India cricketer calls Gill snub 'damage control'; says selectors 'got carried away'
content: Shubman Gill's T20 World Cup 2026 squad omission is seen as a strategic correction, not a snub. Experts suggest selectors are prioritizing defined roles and recent T20 form over past Test heroics. This shift emphasizes specialists for specific game phases, reflecting a pragmatic approach to team composition for the tournament.

title: ‚ÄòDhurandhar‚Äô beats ‚ÄòBaahubali 2‚Äô to record the highest 3rd Saturday collection
content: Ranveer Singh and Aditya Dhar's 'Dhurandhar' continues its record-breaking streak, surpassing 'Pushpa 2: The Rule' and 'Baahubali 2' with a massive Rs 33.50 crore collection on its third Saturday. The film has now amassed Rs 516.50 crore, solidifying its position as a powerful box office performer and inching towards USD 11 million in North America.

title: From heritage lanes to high-tech hubs: How Hyderabad Metro is changing the city
content: The Telangana government is taking over Phase-I of the Hyderabad Metro Rail from Larsen & Toubro for Rs 2,000 crore, aiming to improve public transport and bridge the city's socio-economic divide. This move is part of a larger plan to expand the Metro network, with Phase-II proposals submitted to the Centre for funding and approval.

title: How much Omega-3 do you really need each day? A new global review breaks it down
content: A global review reveals significant inconsistencies in omega-3 fatty acid recommendations worldwide, leaving many individuals short of essential nutrients for lifelong wellness. While the importance of DHA and EPA is recognized, guidelines vary widely, impacting intake targets for adults, teens, and special populations like pregnant women.

title: 'Traumatic': Nora Fatehi after drunk driver rams into her car; recounts horrific accident
content: Bollywood actress Nora Fatehi sustained minor injuries after a drunk driver crashed into her car in Mumbai. Despite the collision, she proceeded with her scheduled performance at the Sunburn music festival. Fatehi later shared her experience on Instagram, emphasizing the dangers of drinking and driving.

content: slangs dominated comment sections, group chats, reels and even dinner-table conversations . these words quietly redefined how emotion, humour, boredom, frustration and exhaustion were expressed online . a term can be born in an Instagram comment section in the morning and trend throughout the day or even for months .

title: Bangladesh unrest: Mob torches BNP leader‚Äôs house; 7-year-old daughter burnt to death
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: 4th elephant death on rail tracks this year, toll rises to 94 since 2019
content: this was the fourth such accident this year . the last two accidents were reported from Jalpaiguri in west Bengal . 81 elephants were killed after being hit by a train between 2019-20 and 2023-24 .

title: Railways revises passenger fares again; AC and express travel gets 'little' costlier
content: a passenger travelling 500 km in a non-AC coach will have to pay Rs 10 extra . this is the second fare revision by Indian Railways during the current financial year . ordinary class passengers travelling up to 215 km will not face any fare hike, railway ministry sources said .

title: Jharkhand man carries baby's body in bag, takes bus 70km home
content: Based in Jamshedpur, he covers entire Kolhan region having three districts namely East Singhbhum, West Singhbhum and Seraikela-Kharsawan reporting on topics such as left wing extremism, city life, urban policies and issues among other wide ranging topics. Read More

title: NHL Power Rankings: Updated 1-32 poll, holiday gifts for each team
content: the Colorado Avalanche remain on top of the ESPN NHL Power Rankings . it's the holiday gifting season, which means what better time than now to hand out a gift to all 32 teams . a panel of commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday .

title: 'OK, now tap your smiley face': How Kentucky's Eva Hudson is finding joy in the game
content: it's match point in the fifth set of the NCAA women's college volleyball semifinals between no.1 seed Kentucky and no. 3 seed Wisconsin . the Badgers blocked the shot out of bounds, but Hudson's power was too much for even the best defenders .

title: Proof that Texas A&M volleyball's run is more methodical than magical
content: all-America hitter ava Underwood hoisted her in the air . the Aggies survived another marathon postseason set . they knocked off no. 1 seed Pittsburgh 29-27, 25-21, 25-20 in the final four .

title: Takeaways: Resilient Bears pull out OT thriller; Eagles repeat as NFC East champs
content: Chicago erases a 10-point fourth-quarter deficit to beat the Packers in overtime and jump into first place in the NFC North . the game was one of the best games of the season as the Bears overcame another late deficit to pull out an OT win over the Packers .

title: College Football Playoff 2025: Quarterfinal first look
content: the canes beat Texas A&M thanks to an interception in the end zone in the final seconds of the game, and they will play Ohio State in the Cotton Bowl . the cotton bowls will be played on Jan. 1 and will be held on Dec. 31 .

title: Inside the Bears' wild comeback win over the Packers in OT
content: the Bears had a 16-9 lead and a 96.9% chance of winning the key NFC North battle . at that point, the Packers' win percentage had dipped to 86.9% . there was no reason to believe in a miracle comeback, except that the bears have lived dangerously all season .

title: The Jake Paul show is far from over, but where does it go from here?
content: Anthony Joshua beats Jake Paul in the sixth round of the heavyweight fight . the fight between Joshua and Joshua was announced on friday . he was outclassed, dropped four times and knocked out by Joshua . his critics say he will continue his boxing career .

title: Arsenal are 'Christmas champions,' but that'll count for nothing if Gunners can't hold
content: arsenal beat Everton 2-1 in their premier league clash on saturday . the win was a slog rather than a win built on attacking football . a first-half penalty was enough to earn the three points .

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who intends to transfer
content: College football's transfer portal officially opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. Once the portal opens, players have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.
